required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Double Trigger in Patients With Low Proportion of Mature Oocytes
clinical_study.official_title: Double Trigger in Patients With Low Proportion of Mature Oocytes. A Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Riyadh Fertility and Reproductive Health center

clinical_study.source: Riyadh Fertility and Reproductive Health center

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this randomized controlled trial is to determine whether co-administration of GnRH agonist and hCG for final oocyte maturation ( 40 and 34 h prior to oocyte retrieval , respectively) can increase the number of mature oocytes in patients with history of low proportion of mature oocytes in previous IVF cycle triggered by HCG.

secondary_outcome.description: The presence of gestational sac detected by ultrasound examination

arm_group.description: GnRH-agonist and HCG are used to trigger ovulation
HCG is used to trigger ovulation

intervention.description: Final follicular maturation is triggered by the coadministration of GnRH-agonist (Triptorelin acetate, decapeptyl 0.2 mg, Slough, United Kingdom) and 10000 IU of HCG, 40 and 34 h prior to oocyte retrieval, respectively
Final follicular maturation is triggered by a dose of 10000 IU of HCG 36 h prior to oocyte retrieval

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with history of low proportion of mature oocytes in previous IVF attempt (triggered by HCG).
- Patients with 6 to 15 mature follicles on the day oocyte trigger in the current IVF-ET attempt
Exclusion Criteria:
- Endometriosis
- PCOS

overall_official.affiliation: Riyadh Fertility and Reproductive Health center

facility.name: Riyadh Fertility and Reproductive Health center

reference.citation: Zilberberg E, Haas J, Dar S, Kedem A, Machtinger R, Orvieto R. Co-administration of GnRH-agonist and hCG, for final oocyte maturation (double trigger), in patients with low proportion of mature oocytes. Gynecol Endocrinol. 2015 Feb;31(2):145-7. doi: 10.3109/09513590.2014.978850. Epub 2014 Nov 11.
